name: Azure Arc-enabled Servers - Update Manager
description: Machines not configured for Azure Update Manager. Enable centralized update management for all Arc-enabled servers.
details: Azure Update Manager provides centralized patch management for Arc-enabled servers across on-premises, multi-cloud, and edge locations. Ensure compliance and security with automated update scheduling.
activationSteps: In Azure Portal, go to Azure Update Manager → Add machines → Select Arc-enabled servers to enable update management.

name: Azure Arc-enabled Servers - Inventory & Tracking
description: Machines not configured for Inventory and Change Tracking. Get visibility into software inventory and configuration changes.
details: Enable Change Tracking and Inventory to monitor software changes, file integrity, and Windows service changes on Arc-enabled servers. Essential for compliance and security.
activationSteps: Enable Change Tracking extension on Arc-enabled servers via Azure Portal → Automation → Change Tracking.

name: Azure Arc-enabled Servers - Guest Configuration
description: Machines not configured for Azure Policy Guest Configuration. Audit and enforce compliance policies on Arc servers.
details: Guest Configuration allows you to audit and enforce configuration standards across Arc-enabled servers. Monitor OS settings, installed applications, and security baselines.
activationSteps: Assign Azure Policy definitions with Guest Configuration to Arc-enabled servers in Azure Policy service.

name: Azure Arc Best Practice Assessment
description: Run best practice assessments to optimize Arc-enabled server configurations and identify security gaps.
details: Best Practice Assessments analyze Arc-enabled servers for security vulnerabilities, performance optimization, and compliance with Microsoft recommendations.
activationSteps: Enable Azure Advisor recommendations for Arc-enabled servers and review assessment reports in Azure Portal.

name: Arc-enabled Servers - Monitoring & Insights
description: Enable Azure Monitor and VM Insights for Arc-enabled servers to track performance and health.
details: Monitor performance metrics, logs, and dependencies for Arc-enabled servers using Azure Monitor. Get insights into CPU, memory, disk, and network utilization.
activationSteps: Install Azure Monitor Agent on Arc-enabled servers and configure data collection rules in Azure Monitor.

name: Arc-enabled Servers - Microsoft Defender for Cloud
description: Protect Arc-enabled servers with Microsoft Defender for Cloud. Detect threats and vulnerabilities across hybrid infrastructure.
details: Microsoft Defender for Cloud provides advanced threat protection, vulnerability assessment, and security recommendations for Arc-enabled servers.
activationSteps: Enable Defender for Servers plan in Microsoft Defender for Cloud and onboard Arc-enabled machines.

name: Arc-enabled Servers - Automated Machine Configuration
description: Use Azure Automation to deploy and manage configurations across Arc-enabled servers at scale.
details: Automate configuration management, script execution, and desired state configuration (DSC) for Arc-enabled servers using Azure Automation.
activationSteps: Create Automation Account and link Arc-enabled servers for configuration management.

name: Arc-enabled Servers - Resource Tagging
description: Organize and manage Arc-enabled servers using Azure tags for cost allocation, governance, and automation.
details: Tags enable organization-wide governance, automated workflows, and cost tracking. Servers without tags are harder to manage and track.
activationSteps: Apply tags to Arc-enabled servers via Azure Portal, CLI, or Azure Policy for automated tagging enforcement.

name: Arc-enabled Servers - Windows Admin Center
description: Manage Arc-enabled Windows Servers through Windows Admin Center extension for remote administration.
details: Windows Admin Center provides browser-based server management with role management, event viewer, registry editor, and performance monitoring.
activationSteps: Install AdminCenter extension on Arc-enabled Windows Servers from Azure Portal Extensions blade.

name: Arc-enabled Servers - Hotpatching (WS2025)
description: Enable hotpatching on Windows Server 2025 Arc-enabled servers for security updates without reboots.
details: Hotpatching applies critical security updates without requiring server reboots, improving uptime and reducing maintenance windows for Windows Server 2025.
activationSteps: Enable hotpatching in Update Manager settings for Windows Server 2025 Arc-enabled servers.
